body:
### Summary

1. It has variants `cluster`, `shared`, `ilp64` which do not influence the contents of the installation, this can lead to many redundant copies of a 6GB+ installation :(.
  
   These variants should be removed, and replaced with query parameters (https://spack-tutorial.readthedocs.io/en/sc20/tutorial_advanced_packaging.html#extra-query-parameters) I can't find the actual docs for this feature.

2. Currently .libs returns system libraries, even when +shared. This should never happen.

Generally I think Spack is too high level to support static linking, cause it doesn't know dependencies. Why not use pkgconfig file or whatever you have. They know the actual linker flags.

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: intel-oneapi-mkl needs improvements
